entry.title: Ambivalent 0.4.0
entry.summary: Changes to allow offline page to list cached pages that users can read while offline.
entry.content:
Changes to allow offline page to list cached pages that users can read while offline. This page can be accessed directly

Changes

  • Moves templates required to be a PWA inside the theme
  • Cache html pages
  • Offline page reads and parses cached html pages to list pages that can be read offline.

entry.title: Ambivalent 0.3.0
entry.summary: Adds Google Tag Manager, GitHub sponsors and this theme can now be a Progressive Web Application.
entry.content:
Adds Google Tag Manager, GitHub sponsors and this theme can now be a Progressive Web Application.

Changes

  • Adds Google Tag Manager
  • Adds GitHub Sponsors
  • Adds aria-label to theme toggler
  • Allows main panel to fill available screen space (desktop)
  • Use read post instead of read more
  • New logo for website

entry.title: Ambivalent 0.2.0
entry.summary: Changes dark theme to use AMOLED black, adds custom scrollbars and other minor changes.
entry.content:
In this release we attempt to make the site look a bit nicer, improve page load and add some fixes for Safari.

Here's the full list of changes:

Changes

  • Use AMOLED black for dark theme
  • Adds custom scrollbar for webkit browsers
  • Remove default SITE_LOGO
  • Improve page load by deferring pygments.css
  • Fix link to GitHub page
  • Fixes side menu scrolling on mobile
  • Fixes for Safari

entry.title: Ambivalent 0.1.0
entry.summary: This is Ambivalent's first release! Ambivalent is a lightweight theme for Pelican, featuring a mobile first responsive design and light/dark themes.
entry.content:
Ambivalent is a lightweight theme for Pelican.

I plan to use Pelican and Ambivalent on my own blog and will be adding more features as I have a need for them.

Features

  • Lightweight
  • Responsive design
  • Light and Dark themes
  • SEO best practices
  • Disqus integration
  • Google Analytics
  • Google AdSense
  • Multi language support via i18n_subsites
  • Article read time via readtime
  • Sitemap via sitemap
